data.title: 6 Make Up Resources You Must Have For Your Wedding
data.meta_description: When it comes to weddings, everyone wants to look effortlessly flawless. But, sometimes it’s a challenge because of the wrong make-up resources. Whether it’s your bestie’s wedding or yours, your make-up will be the key to completing your look. So, you absolutely can’t go wrong. And you need the right tools to achieve a luminous look. Here is all you need to do to get your make-up on fleek.
data.text:
The video of 54-year-old Neeru Saini’s recreation of viral ‘Gajagamini’ walk from ‘Heeramandi’ has gained a reaction from Netflix itself. Social media users have been showering love on the video that recreated Aditi Rao Hydari’s walk from the series.

Besides ‘Heeramandi’s’ backdrop, costumes, cast and more, there’s something more to it--the intimate scenes and a few of the actors opened up about these intimate scenes recently. Here's what they had to say!

After Manisha’s successful role in Netflix series ‘Heeramandi’, let’s take a fun quiz to match her million-dollar onscreen facial expressions, starring in films like 'Bombay', ‘Sanju’, ‘Akele Hum Akele Tum’, ‘Gupt’, 'Lajja’ and more to the correct hindi movie names.

After her successful portrayal as 'Mallikajaan' in Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Heeramandi', Manisha Koirala gets candid about her battle with cancer, divorce with Samrat Dahal and being open to finding new love again. Here's everything Manisha has to say.

Starring Manisha Koirala, Richa Chadha, Sonakshi Sinha, Sharmin Segal and Sanjeeda Shaikh in lead roles, here’s our honest review of ‘Heeramandi: The Diamond Bazaar’.

Recently, Bollywood actress Aditi Rao Hydari took to Instagram to share an adorable engagement picture with Siddharth and we all are hearts. Check it out here!!

Sanjay Leela Bhansali’s ‘Heeramandi’ first look is out now and it features Manisha Koirala, Sonakshi Sinha, Aditi Rao Hydari, Sharmin Segal, Richa Chadha, and Sanjeeda Sheikh

As 'Akele Hum Akele Tum' clocks in 28 years, take our toughest quiz on the film by completing the lyrics of Manisha Koirala and Aamir Khan’s hit songs like ‘Dil Kehta Hai’, ‘Dil Mera Churaya Kyun’ and ‘Aisa Zakhm Diya Hai’

If you are a real 90s Bollywood fan, then it's time to prove your fandom. Take our fun quiz on the Bollywood film ‘Dil Se’, starring Shah Rukh Khan, Manisha Koirala and Preity Zinta. Do you think you can ace the quiz? Try it out.

Bollywood has no dearth of wedding looks, so if you are looking for a stunning bridal look for your wedding day, we found seven of the most stunning onscreen lehenga looks from Bollywood movies, think Rani Mukerji’s lehenga look in ‘Kabhi Alvida Naa Kehna’ and more.

From ‘1942: A Love Story’ to ‘Dil Se..’ in the 90s, to ‘Lajja’ and ‘Shehzada’, here are Manisha Koirala’s soft, minimal, and subtle on-screen makeup looks for beauty inspiration.

Are you a die-hard Manisha Koirala fan? Prove by identifying her popular movies like ‘Dil Se..’, ‘Gupt’, ‘Mann’ and others from her onscreen white outfits. Let’s find out if you can get a full score in our trivia quiz.

Netflix recently shared the first look of Sanjay Leela Bhansali’s upcoming web series, ‘Heeramandi’, featuring Manisha Koirala, Aditi Rao Hydari, Sharmin Segal, Richa Chadha, Sanjeeda Shaikh, and Sonakshi Sinha. Here’s what we think about it.

Kartik Aaryan’s latest release ‘Shehzada’ is a delightful blend of comedy, action and a lot of emotions. The actor manages to entertain us with his power-packed yet fun performance as well as some crazy dance moves. Here’s a review of Kartik Aaryan’s ‘Shehzada’, also starring Kriti Sanon, Paresh Rawal, Ronit Roy, Manisha Koirala and Rajpal Yadav.

Here is how the makeup aesthetics and beauty looks of 90s heroines evolved over the years. We show their style in their debut films, primarily from the 90s, and their makeup looks now in their latest onscreen appearances. So, we list the looks of 90s actresses like Shilpa Shetty, Sushmita Sen, Rani Mukerji, Sonali Bendre, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, Madhuri Dixit, Raveena Tandon, Karisma Kapoor, Kajol, Manisha Koirala, Preity Zinta, and Tabu in their early days, and their beauty transformation.

Director Sanjay Leela Bhansali has had a stellar year thanks to his film ‘Gangubai Kathiawadi’ winning accolades. Now, the director has announced his first non-film music album, ‘Sukoon’, which will be released this year. Here’s what we know.

From ‘Ek Ladki Ko Dekha’ and ‘Mera Mann’ to ‘Dil Se Re’ and ‘Dil Kehta Hai’, only real 90s Bollywood music fans will be able to guess more than half of these Manisha Koirala songs from just a still from the music videos.

Kartik Aaryan just wished his co-star Kiara Advani a happy birthday by posting a first look from their upcoming movie, ‘Satyaprem Ki Katha’ on his social media, and the fans are going crazy.

There are many actresses who made their debut opposite Shah Rukh Khan. From Shilpa Shetty Kundra in ‘Baazigar’ to Deepika Padukone in ‘Om Shanti Om’, here’s taking a look at them and what they are doing now.

Here’s why we are looking forward to watching Sanjay Leela Bhansali’s next project and his first web-series, Heeramandi, which will air on Netflix. Set in Lahore’s red light district, the show might star Sonakshi Sinha, Aditi Rao Hydari, and Manisha Koirala, as per several reports. After ‘Gangubai’, ‘Saawariya’, and ‘Devdas’, this will be his third film about courtesans.

As per latest reports, Sonakshi Sinha, Manisha Koirala, and Aditi Rao Hydari are set to join the cast of Sanjay Leela Bhansali’s Netflix series Heeramandi. Here are all the deets!

Indians treat drug and alcohol addiction as a moral issue instead as one relating to mental health. Talking about celebs who battled addiction and normalising the subject is the first step to beating addiction.

Bollywood actor Manisha Koirala was extremely popular through the 90s for her work in films like ‘Bombay’, ‘1942: A Love Story’ and ‘Dil Se…’ among others. She was diagnosed with ovarian cancer in 2012 and was cancer free by 2014. Many believed that despite some great performances, Manisha Koirala was rather underrated. If you’ve been a fan of her work, take our quiz and try to score 6/6.

There are so many women who bravely fight against cancer. We should celebrate the ones who have beaten the disease and now stand strong for those who need the inspiration.

Sanjay Leela Bhansali’s ‘90s classic starring Aishwarya Rai, Salman Khan and Ajay Devgn is still a favourite of many. Here are some lesser-known facts about the movie we bet you didn’t know.

Manisha Koirala is a true warrior! After beating cancer, the veteran actress managed to pick up the pieces of her life and join them back together with positivity and grace. Today, we’re taking a look at her super interesting sartorial picks in the recent past.

Actor Rahul Roy recently suffered a brain stroke while filming in extreme weather conditions in Kargil. As the actor recovers in the ICU here are some of his best performances from the past.

Starring Bobby Deol, Manisha Koirala, and Kajol in lead roles, the movie is one of the most popular Bollywood thrillers out there. If you have enjoyed watching it, take this quiz to test your knowledge on the same.

From Mahima Choudhry to Manisha Koirala, here’s a roundup of what our favourite ‘90s Bollywood celebrities are up to now to take you through a hella nostalgic ride.

The tried and tested formula of selling a film with a wafer-thin plot by packaging it with good music seems to have worked well for Bollywood in the past few years. Here’s a list of Bollywood movies that we remember only for the soundtrack and not the story.

The ’90s gave us a lot of beauty moments which we grew up seeing as inspiration. These looks were so iconic that it shaped our aesthetics and made us want to try similar looks. Some of these movie makeup looks seen on these actresses are still embedded in our minds, and will remain timeless!

In a recent interview, Manisha Koirala said that she isn’t afraid of the coronavirus pandemic because she has been a cancer survivor.

Shah Rukh Khan’s Rahul was sexist and toxic in Kuch Kuch Hota Hai and Dil Toh Pagal Hai, and Raj was a creep who stalked Simran in Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge. Suri pretended to be someone else to get his wife to like him in Rab Ne Bana Di Jodi. SRK has always played romantic heroes who are problematic and borderline villainous.

Manisha Koirala has been in the industry for three decades now. The Dil Se actress reigned in the ‘90s with movies like Gupt, Khamoshi, 1942: A Love Story, Mann etc. She went on to battle cancer and returned to the big screen recently with Sanju and Netflix’s Maska. It’s been a visual treat to watch her journey. However, we’re even more inspired by her classic style. Take a look at a few of her onscreen and off-screen looks that prove Manishaji’s fashion choices are evergreen.

Many of the actresses we grew up watching in the 90s are not seen in cinema anymore. While Kajol, Rani Mukerji, Tabu, and Aishwarya Rai are still around, several other popular stars stopped working in films, at least in the lead roles we used to see them in. If you miss seeing them on the silver screen and wonder why they quit, read on!

From Jaani Dushman: Ek Anokhi Kahani to Kalank, Bollywood’s creative minds, and tools, still have a long way to go. Here is a list of movies that delivered some epic fails through computerized imagery and special effects.

While most consider Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam as Sanjay Leela Bhansali’s best movie so far, we think it’s Khamoshi: The Musical.

If there is one genre Bollywood fails more often than others, it’s horror. From the 2000s, we’ve been fed some pretty bad scary movies that deserve to be remade today as comedies. Check out our list, we’re sure you’ll agree!

From Biwi No. 1 to Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikander and Dil Hai Ki Manta Nahi, these Bollywood movie name translations are sure to leave you in splits.

Manisha Koirala recently opened up about how she’s dealing with the current nationwide lockdown due to the Coronavirus outbreak. She compares the pandemic to her battle against cancer, sharing with us valuable lessons she learnt along the way.

On the occasion of World Cancer Day, we take a look at a few of the celebrities who battled with the disease. The website ‘India Against Cancer’ states that over 11 lakh people register as new cancer patients and there are around 2.25 million people currently battling it in India. If this wasn’t sad enough, then over seven lakh deaths are registered in the country every year. We have lost notable celebrities to cancer in the past, from actors Nargis Dutt, Feroz Khan, Rajesh Khanna, Vinod Khanna, Tom Alter, to ace music composer and singer Aadesh Shrivastava. As we remember the ones we lost, here are the people who survived cancer and are thriving today:

The city of Mumbai hosted the annual charity event for its police force yesterday and an entourage of Bollywood celebrities attended to showcase their support for them. On the red carpet we saw some stylish outfits and here are our best and worst picks:

The 2010s was the decade for wellness. While there are some wellness trends we love and some we hate, there’s one that we are so glad is here to stay: Going to therapy for mental health.

Women are not incapable of expressing consent, a stereotype enforced by Bollywood and mainstream TV, has just led many of us to believe that.

October is Breast Cancer Awareness month, so we are applauding the famous women who have done their bit to start a conversation about the disease by sharing their own struggles with the malady.

Disease and ill health are, unfortunately, among the inescapable realities of life and spare no one--not even the rich or famous. Many of the stars we know and love have also fought serious, often life-threatening health problems without us even knowing. We see them as heroes and heroines on screen, but they are heroes off it as well.

Nagarjuna Akkineni is an actor of many talents. He has starred in several films and television shows. In Bollywood, he is fondly remembered with the song “Tu Mile Dil Khile” alongside Manisha Koirala. Here are 10 facts about the south star on his 60th birthday.

For the next time you are caught in a downpour, here are 15 Bollywood songs to turn to, to turn that 2-hour wait into a jamming session.

From Deepika Padukone to Karan Johar and Anushka Sharma – these Bollywood celebrities opened up about their battle against depression and anxiety, and why it’s important to talk about it.

It takes a lot of courage to talk about health issues, especially for celebrities who are always under the scanner. Thanks to social media, there is always a fear of being judged for speaking out--even more so for celebs, who are sitting ducks for trolls. However, there are some female actors in tinsel town who have been brave enough to not care about how they will be perceived. They chose to share the difficult times they’ve had with the world, especially when it comes to mental health issues, body image disorders, and other health ailments. Let's take a look at all those brave hearts who inspired us in ways more than they can imagine.
